page.title: 01THE EGYPTIAN SPRINGS
page.content: In Lower Hartwell there is a natural spring .It is called The Egytian spring.It has two square basins about one metre long to collect water to act as a water trough.There is also a little cavern by the springs. The water at one time supplied the farm which only fairly recently turned to the mainwater supply.the water now is used for the cattle.There is Egyptain writing on the cavern and in English means"water is best".It was built by a tee-totaller who was very interested in Egypt.He held an annual celebration of water,after which he gave a sum of money to the nearest inn(the Bugle Horn)for its loss of money from the sale of alcohol.What he did not realize was that many so called "tee-totallers"were slipping away to the pubs.
